content:
THE DELICATE diplomatic dance that America is performing during Tsai Ing-Wen’s visit hints at the island’s strategic importance. Two of the deadly blazes of Australia’s “Black Saturday” were deliberately set; we ask what makes someone start fires. And, the hunt for a cheap holiday read in France: by law books must be sold at full price, but sellers are finding ways around that. Runtime: 22 min

Listen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher | TuneIn

ex: adj. 微妙的；精美的，雅致的；柔和的；易碎的；纤弱的；清淡可口的

n. 粉瘤，[医] 皮脂囊肿；人口集中的大城市

wp.Eric Wen: 师温天立;师埃里克·温;艾瑞克·温;温天力

eg2: I have confidence, "  said.
我有信心。 “温家宝说。
"We want our clients to get out of their home and enjoy something they have not tried before, " said  Zhenhua.
文振华说，“我们希望我们的客户走出自己的家门去享受那些他们没有尝试过的事物。”
What do you say to people who listen to your speeches and they say we love everything  Jiabao says, but we don't see the actions of political reform.
那些听你的演讲的人，他们说「我喜欢温总理的讲话，但是我们并没有看到政治体制改革的行动啊」，你对此有什么看法？

ex: n. 火焰；火灾；烈火；（光或色彩等的）展现
v. 闪耀；熊熊燃烧；发亮光；怒视
网络 火光；光辉；闪光
eg2: A huge fire was blazing in the fireplace.
壁炉中火烧得正旺。
Within minutes the whole building was blazing.
不消几分钟整个大楼便成了一片火海。
He rushed back into the blazing house.
他又冲进了燃烧着的房子。
The sun blazed down from a clear blue sky.
耀眼的阳光从清澈蔚蓝的天空中照射下来。
The garden blazed with colour.
花园里姹紫嫣红。
Her eyes were blazing with fury.
她的双眼燃烧着怒火。
The story was blazed all over the daily papers.
那个传闻被各家报纸炒得沸沸扬扬。
In the distance machine guns were blazing.
机关枪在远处不停地射击。
The department is blazing a trail in the field of laser surgery.
这个部门正在为激光外科学领域开辟一条新路。
The department is blazing a trail in the field of laser surgery.
这个部门正在为激光外科学领域开辟一条新路。
Five people died in the blaze.
火灾中有五人丧生。
Dry wood makes a good blaze.
干木柴烧得旺。
The gardens are a blaze of colour.
花园里姹紫嫣红。
a blaze of lights in the city centre
市中心通明的灯火
the bright blaze of the sun
太阳的光辉
a blaze of glory
荣耀
They got married in a blaze of publicity.
他们结婚的事受到了传媒的广泛关注。
a blaze of anger/passion/hate
怒火╱激情╱仇恨的迸发
What the blazes have you done?
你到底搞的什么名堂？
What the blazes have you done?
你到底搞的什么名堂？

ex: adv. 故意地；谨慎地；慎重地
eg2: He deliberately roughed the goal-keeper.
他故意冲撞守门员。
She deliberately stayed behind after work to go with me.
下班后她故意留下来等我一起走。
The acrobat deliberately faulted the performance once to make it look difficult.
表演者故意把表演做错一次，以显得表演很难。

wp.diplomatic immunity: 外交豁免权;外交豁免;外交宽免权;越界格杀
wp.diplomatic rank: 外交官衔;社交官衔;交际官衔;酬酢官衔
wp.diplomatic service: 外交部门;后在外交部门;外交事务;韩国外交部门
wp.Diplomatic Corps: 外交使节团;外交使团;外交团;外交官

ex: adj. 外交的；外交上的；老练的
eg2: This would be against diplomatic etiquette.
这将在外交上犯失礼的错误。
He has long credentials of diplomatic service.
他的外交工作资历很深。
He was more than my match in diplomatic shrewdness.
论外交手腕之精明， 我远不敌他。

ex: n. 贱民（印度的最下阶级）

wp.Pariah state: 被排斥的国家;恶棍国家
wp.pariah dog: 流浪犬;生活在北非或南亚的一种野生的或家养的当地杂种狗;流浪狗;贱狗

eg2: First, simply, it was a matter of face, of reducing its -state image —a tangible symbol of being welcomed back into the global community.
首先，简单地说，这是面子问题，可以弱化它的贱民国家形象——一个欢迎它回归国际社会的切实象征。
While the report was not confirmed, it is consistent with China's increasing desire to distance itself from  states in Africa and elsewhere that used to be treated as old friends.
尽管这些消息没有得到证实，但它符合中国越发渴望与非洲及其他地方的贱民国家（在过去，它们被当作老朋友对待）保持距离的愿望。
He had been known as the ruthless leader of a pariah state, a butcher, a delusional man divorced from reality.
他就是被人称为一个贱民国度的残忍领导人，一个屠夫，一个脱离实际只会妄想的男子汉。

wp.strategic inertia: 战略惯性;策略惰性;计谋惯性
wp.strategic goals: 战略目标;策略目标;战略目的
wp.strategic group: 战略组;战略群组;策略群组;战略集团
wp.STRATEGIC DIRECTION: 战略方向;战略指挥;战略导向;策略性指示
wp.Strategic interaction: 策略互动;策略互动行为;战略互动;策略性互动
wp.Strategic move: 策略举措;战略行动;策略行动;战略举措

eg2: The general laid down a few strategic targets on the map.
将军在地图上标明了几个战略目标。
They are pushing hard to improve their strategic nuclear capabilities.
他们正全力以赴增强他们的战略核力量。
Despite their intentions and being in a strategic position, they often stop the progress being called for.
尽管他们的意图和存在是战略的关键位置，但是他们经常停止这一进程。

Title: “It’s a pro-Western democracy, yet the president is a pariah”—Taiwan’s leader on tour

paperStatistics.title: “It’s a pro-Western democracy, yet the president is a pariah”—Taiwan’s leader on tour
